subject: Relationships
title: Expressing Needs Without Demands
description: A 60-second lesson on Expressing Needs Without Demands.

hook.text: 'I need more quality time' builds connection. 'You never spend time with me' builds walls.

buildup.text: Marshall Rosenberg's Nonviolent Communication teaches: state feelings, identify needs, make requests â€” not demands.

discovery.text: A request gives the partner choice. A demand creates resentment even when complied with.

twist.text: The hardest part isn't phrasing â€” it's knowing your own needs. Many people can't name what they actually want.

climax.text: Expressing needs clearly is an act of courage. It risks rejection but opens the door to real intimacy.

punchline.text: A need expressed as a request invites love. A demand repels it.

quiz.question: What does Nonviolent Communication teach about expressing needs?
options: State feelings, identify needs, and make requests
